intro: Stisseria articulata, commonly known as the jointed stisseria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, jointed stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom during the dry season. Stisseria articulata is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
